result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Megail Price was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Megail Price

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon Megail Price in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  William P. Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  

AS TO COUNT 2: 
Court orders Defendant to pay a forfeiture of $200.00 including costs and DNA surcharge to be paid by 2-28-2017 or Civil Judgment.
Court orders provide DNA sample.
Court orders 1 day credit.


Filed:
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Brandon Megail Price in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Ian Franklin Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel advised the Court that he is in trial and requested an adjournment.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 4.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon Megail Price in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: Pursuant to negotiations and upon motion of the State, Count 1 is dismissed but read in. 

AS TO COUNT 2: 

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

All parties are advised effective August 1, 2016 this case will be assigned to the Honorable Michael Hanrahan, Branch 4 in Room 515 of the Courthouse.

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 8/4/2016 at 8:30, branch 4.

Defendant Brandon Megail Price in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Status conference held off the record.  Defense requests plea hearing date.  State does not object.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 21.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon Megail Price in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests more time to review. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon Megail Price in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Newly retained.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon Megail Price in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant retained attorney James Toran.   Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Status conference scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon Megail Price in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon Megail Price in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests an adjourned Status Conference. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brandon Megail Price in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for pretrial conference.  Defendant sent to Public Defender's office to be evaluated and qualifies.  Case scheduled for status of counsel in Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no driving without a valid driver's license.   Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brandon Megail Price in court.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  OCCR Tape#15-194
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 45.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 10-07-2015 at 01:30pm
